definitions: young actress seeking fame or beginning to achieve success in films
astronomical object that is a small or relatively faint star
examples: The Hollywood starlet signed her first major studio contract
Many starlets struggle for years before landing breakthrough roles
Astronomers discovered several starlets in the distant galaxy cluster
The telescope revealed starlets forming within the stellar nursery

definitions: natural illumination that comes from stars in the night sky
examples: They walked home by starlight through the quiet countryside
The starlight was bright enough to read by that clear night

definitions: small to medium-sized bird with dark plumage often showing iridescent colors
examples: A flock of starlings performed aerial acrobatics at sunset
European starlings have become invasive in North America

definitions: theoretical or fictional spacecraft designed for travel between star systems
examples: The science fiction novel featured a starship exploring distant galaxies
Engineers debate whether building actual starships will ever be feasible

definitions: point in time or place at which something begins
sudden involuntary movement caused by surprise or alarm
initial advantage given to competitors in a race or contest
examples: The start of the marathon was delayed by heavy rain
We made an early start to avoid traffic congestion
She gave a start when the door suddenly slammed shut
The loud noise made everyone give a violent start
The younger runners gave the veterans a ten-second start
Despite his head start, she caught up quickly

definitions: appetizer or first course served at the beginning of a meal
electric motor that turns an engine to start it running
person who starts in a race or begins something new
examples: The restaurant offers soup or salad as a starter choice
We ordered several starters to share before the main course
The mechanic replaced the faulty starter motor yesterday
Turn the key to engage the starter and fire the engine
All the starters lined up at the beginning of the race
She's a self-starter who needs minimal supervision

definitions: action or process of beginning something or setting it in motion
position or point from which something begins or originates
examples: Starting a new business requires careful planning and capital
The starting of the engine proved difficult in cold weather
Choose your starting position carefully before the race begins
The starting point for our hike was the visitor center

definitions: sudden shock or alarm that causes an involuntary reaction
examples: The loud bang gave everyone quite a startle
She recovered quickly from her initial startle

definitions: newly established business venture typically in technology or innovation sectors
process of starting a computer system or initializing a program
examples: The tech startup raised millions in venture capital funding
Many startups fail within their first three years of operation
The computer's startup sequence takes about thirty seconds
Check the startup settings if programs load too slowly

definitions: suffering or death caused by prolonged lack of food or essential nutrients
examples: International aid prevented mass starvation during the drought
The refugees faced starvation without emergency food supplies

definitions: condition of suffering from severe lack of food or being extremely hungry
examples: The starving of prisoners violated international human rights laws
After days without food, their starving became life-threatening

definitions: secret store or supply of something valuable kept hidden for future use
examples: Police discovered a stash of weapons in the basement
She kept a stash of chocolate hidden from her children

definitions: particular condition that someone or something is in at a specific time
nation or territory considered as an organized political community under one government
formal or official declaration or presentation of facts or views
examples: The house was in a terrible state after the party
Her mental state improved with proper treatment and support
California is the most populous state in the United States
The state provides free education to all children
The president will deliver the State of the Union address tonight
Please state your name and occupation for the record

definitions: skill and knowledge required for managing state affairs and conducting government diplomacy
examples: The ambassador's statecraft prevented a diplomatic crisis
Effective statecraft requires balancing domestic and international interests

definitions: formal declaration of facts or opinions expressed in words
document showing financial transactions and account balance over a period
distinctive item or action intended to convey a particular message or impression
examples: The witness provided a sworn statement to the police
The company issued a statement denying the allegations
Your bank statement shows all transactions from last month
The accountant reviewed the financial statements carefully
Her bold jewelry made a strong fashion statement
The protest was intended as a political statement

definitions: experienced and respected political leader known for wisdom and diplomatic skill
examples: The elder statesman advised younger politicians on foreign policy
Churchill is remembered as one of Britain's greatest statesmen

definitions: crackling or hissing noise caused by electrical interference in telecommunications
state of inactivity or equilibrium with no movement or change
examples: The radio static made it hard to hear the broadcast
Lightning causes static that interferes with television reception
The company remained in static for years without growth
After months of static, negotiations finally showed progress

definitions: regular stopping place on a public transportation route for passengers
building or facility from which broadcasts originate or operations are conducted
military base or post where personnel are permanently assigned
assigned place or position where someone performs their duties
examples: The train arrives at the station every hour on weekdays
Meet me at the subway station near the museum
The radio station broadcasts news twenty-four hours daily
The television station upgraded its transmission equipment
Soldiers reported to their station for deployment overseas
The naval station houses three thousand military personnel
The guard remained at his station throughout the night
Each nurse has a station on the hospital floor

definitions: person who owns or operates a shop selling stationery and office supplies
examples: The local stationer ordered special pens for the customer
Ask the stationer about bulk discounts on printer paper

definitions: materials used for writing including paper, envelopes, pens, and related supplies
examples: The office manager ordered new stationery for the department
She chose elegant stationery for her wedding invitations

definitions: person in charge of a railway station and its operations
examples: The stationmaster announced delays due to signal problems
Contact the stationmaster about lost luggage claims

definitions: numerical data or fact collected and analyzed for reference or analysis
examples: That statistic about unemployment surprised many economists
Each statistic was carefully verified before publication

definitions: expert who collects, analyzes, and interprets numerical data using statistical methods
examples: The statistician calculated probability distributions for the study
Government statisticians track economic indicators monthly

definitions: statues collectively or the art of making statues and sculptural works
examples: The museum's statuary includes works from ancient Greece
Renaissance statuary demonstrates incredible artistic skill

definitions: three-dimensional representation of a person, animal, or form carved or cast in material
examples: The bronze statue commemorates the city's founder
Ancient statues provide insight into past civilizations

definitions: small statue or figurine typically used as decoration or award
examples: She won a golden statuette at the film festival
The shelf displayed a collection of porcelain statuettes

definitions: natural height of a human body in standing position
level of respect or importance achieved through accomplishment or position
examples: The doctor measured the child's stature during the checkup
Basketball players often have impressive stature
Her stature in the scientific community grew with each publication
The senator's political stature increased after the successful legislation

definitions: relative social or professional position within a hierarchy or society
current condition or state of affairs at a particular time
examples: Her status as CEO gave her significant influence
Social status often determines access to opportunities
Check the status of your application online
The project status report is due Friday

definitions: written law formally enacted by a legislative body and set down in writing
examples: The new statute prohibits texting while driving
Federal statutes override conflicting state laws

definitions: curved wooden strip forming part of a barrel or similar container
set of five horizontal lines on which musical notes are written
examples: The cooper replaced a broken stave in the wine barrel
Oak staves give whiskey barrels their distinctive character
The composer wrote notes across multiple staves simultaneously
Each stave represents a different instrument in the score

definitions: period of remaining in a place as a guest or visitor
rope or wire supporting or stabilizing a mast or structure
postponement or suspension of legal proceedings or judgment
examples: Their stay at the resort lasted two wonderful weeks
We enjoyed our stay despite the rainy weather
The ship's stays kept the mast secure during storms
Tighten the stays to stabilize the antenna tower
The judge granted a stay of execution pending appeal
The court issued a stay on the new regulations

definitions: position or role that someone or something else should have or usually has
examples: She attended the meeting in her boss's stead
The vice president served in the president's stead

definitions: person with whom one has a regular romantic relationship
examples: She introduced her steady to her parents last weekend
Having a steady made high school more enjoyable

definitions: slice of meat, typically beef, cut perpendicular to muscle fibers for grilling or frying
examples: He ordered a ribeye steak cooked medium rare
The restaurant specializes in aged steaks and seafood

definitions: restaurant specializing in serving steaks and other meat dishes
examples: The new steakhouse downtown requires reservations weeks ahead
They celebrated their anniversary at an upscale steakhouse

definitions: something acquired at a price much lower than its actual value
examples: That vintage jacket was a steal at twenty dollars
The house was such a steal they bought it immediately

definitions: person or thing that draws attention away from others, especially in performance
examples: The child actor was a real scene stealer
That red dress is definitely a show stealer

definitions: act of taking another person's property without permission or legal right
examples: The security cameras recorded the stealing of merchandise
Repeated stealing resulted in criminal charges

definitions: cautious and surreptitious action or movement to avoid detection
examples: The spy moved with stealth through enemy territory
Stealth technology makes aircraft invisible to radar

definitions: vapor into which water is converted when heated to boiling point
power or energy generated by steam pressure used to drive machinery
examples: Steam rose from the hot coffee cup
The bathroom filled with steam after the hot shower
The industrial revolution was powered by steam
Steam engines transformed transportation in the nineteenth century

definitions: boat propelled by a steam engine, especially used on rivers in the past
examples: Mark Twain piloted steamboats on the Mississippi River
The restored steamboat offers dinner cruises

definitions: ship powered by steam engines for ocean or large lake travel
container or appliance used to cook food with steam
examples: The steamer crossed the Atlantic in seven days
Passengers boarded the steamer bound for Europe
Use a bamboo steamer for perfect dumplings
The vegetable steamer preserves nutrients better than boiling

definitions: science fiction genre featuring steam-powered technology in Victorian-era or alternative history settings
examples: The steampunk convention featured elaborate Victorian-inspired costumes
Her steampunk novel imagines steam-powered computers

definitions: large ship powered by steam engines for passenger or cargo transport
examples: The luxury steamship carried immigrants to America
Steamships replaced sailing vessels for commercial shipping

definitions: horse, especially a spirited one used for riding in literary or formal contexts
examples: The knight mounted his trusty steed for battle
Her Arabian steed won numerous equestrian competitions

definitions: strong alloy of iron with carbon and other elements used in construction and manufacturing
mental or emotional strength and determination in facing challenges
examples: The bridge framework uses reinforced steel beams
Stainless steel resists corrosion better than regular steel
She showed nerves of steel during the crisis
The team's steel helped them win the championship

definitions: person who works in steel production or the steel industry
examples: The steelman operated the blast furnace for thirty years
Steelmen formed powerful unions in industrial cities

definitions: sharply angled slope or incline on terrain or a structure
examples: The trail included a steep that challenged even experienced hikers
Be careful on that steep near the cliff edge

definitions: container or device used for steeping tea or making infusions
examples: Pour hot water over tea leaves in the steeper
This ceramic steeper keeps tea at perfect temperature

definitions: tall tower forming part of a church, typically topped with a spire
examples: The church steeple was visible from miles away
Lightning struck the steeple during yesterday's storm
